bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 7346.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 7 of section 9 of article I of the Constitution.[Page H10337]

item.title: Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2017

item.title: Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2018

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1686)

summary.text:
Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2018

This bill amends the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2018 to require the federal government to compensate employees of federal contractors that provide retail, food, custodial, or security services who are placed on unpaid leave as a result of a lapse in appropriations beginning in FY2019.

bill.title: Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2018

item.title: Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2018
To provide for the compensation of Federal contractor employees that may be placed on unpaid leave as a result of the Federal Government shutdown, and for other purposes.
Low-Wage Federal Contractor Employee Back Pay Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
